panels.title: Introduction
panels.markdownContent: This dashboard provides vitals about OpenObserve using the metrics exposed by OpenObserve. Select the namespace in which Openobserve is installed and navigate to the appropriate tabs. Below details are available: - CPU - Memory - Storage - Network For support reach out to hello@openobserve.ai

panels.title: CPU utilization
panels.description: The amount of CPU used by each pod in the cluster. CPU is reported as the average core usage measured in cpu units. 1 cpu, in Kubernetes, is equivalent to 1 vCPU/Core for cloud providers, and 1 hyper-thread on bare-metal Intel processors.

panels.title: CPU Utilization (From Requests)
panels.description: When a CPU Request is present in a pod configuration, this chart shows how much CPU each pod uses as a percentage against that request.

panels.title: CPU Utilization (From Limits)
panels.description: When a CPU Limit is present in a pod configuration, this chart shows how much CPU each pod uses as a percentage against that limit.

panels.title: Memory usage
panels.description: The amount of memory being used by each Kubernetes pod.

panels.title: Memory Utilization (From Requests)
panels.description: When a Memory Request is present in a pod configuration, this chart shows how much memory each pod uses as a percentage against that request value.

panels.title: Memory Utilization (From Limits)
panels.description: When a Memory Limit is present in a pod configuration, this chart shows how much memory each pod uses as a percentage against that limit value.
